xocs:funding.xocs:funding-agency-matched-string: Special Task Force for Activating Research

xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: The authors would like to thank Prof. O. Chailapakul, and Prof. S. Ekgasit at the department of Chemistry, Chulalongkorn University for the access to the plasma cleaner and the Raman spectroscopy, respectively. This research was supported by the Ratchadaphiseksomphot Endowment Fund of Chulalongkorn University (CU56-906-AM) and Special Task Force for Activating Research (STAR) of Chulalongkorn University, through Micro-Nano Fabrication Technology Research Group (GSTAR 56-005-21-002).

organization.$: Department of Materials Science and Engineering
Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST)

head.citation-title: A novel method for transferring graphene onto PDMS
head.abstracts: © 2015 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved. Graphene has been attracting great attention from scientific community due to its astonishing mechanical, optical, and electrical properties, especially, graphene films synthesized by chemical vapor deposition (CVD) method are large, uniform and high-quality. CVD-grown graphene films have been successfully transferred onto various kinds of substrates such as SiO 2 /Si, quartz, PET, and plastics. However, graphene transfer onto polydimethylsiloxane (PDMS) substrates for device development has been limited due to the very low surface energy of PDMS. Here, we present a novel method to transfer graphene onto PDMS substrates by utilizing a thin layer of SU-8 as an adhesion layer. The SU-8 adhesion layer significantly improves the adhesion between the graphene layer and the PDMS substrate resulting in successful graphene transfer onto the PDMS substrate. This opens up a great potential of using graphene on PDMS substrates for the development of a wide range of graphene-based transparent and flexible devices.

copyright.$: Copyright 2019 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.
